clinical_study.brief_title: A Rehabilitation Program for Adolescents With Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: An Integrative Approach Based Psychoeducation, Heart Rate Variability Coherence Biofeedback and Elements of, Pacing Cognitive Behavior Therapy

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the programme is to develop a treatment model for adolescents with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome. The program consists of 4 elements lasting for 12 months, psychoeducation reflecting the current knowledge about the disease, Heart Rate Variability Coherence Biofeedback, pacing and activity planning and some principles of cognitive behaviour therapy. The study is designed as a Single-Case study including 10- 15 participants.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: assessed by Inventory of Life Quality for Children and Adolescents

secondary_outcome.description: assessed by Mood and Feelings Questionnaire

arm_group.description: 28 sessions during 12 months with focus on psychoeducation, activity planning, and thoughts and feelings connected to having a serious chronic disease. From week 13 to week 32 a training programme aiming at balancing heart rate variability.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who meet the diagnostic criteria of chronic fatigue syndrome
- Clinically evaluated, exclude any disease that can explain the chronic fatigue;
- Diagnosed and evaluated within the health region, Central Norway
- With written consent form signed by themselves and their parents.
Exclusion Criteria:
- serious comorbidity such as anorexia, psychosis
- serious depression
